title: Trivia Recall
description: How sharp is your memory? Answer these recall-based trivia questions that test what you remember!

questions.question: How many states are there in the United States of America?
questions.explanation: The United States has 50 states. The last two to join were Alaska and Hawaii, both admitted in 1959.

questions.question: How many letters are in the English alphabet?
questions.explanation: The English alphabet has 26 letters, from A to Z.

questions.question: How many continents are there on Earth?
questions.explanation: There are 7 continents: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, North America, and South America.

questions.question: How many planets are in our solar system?
questions.explanation: There are 8 planets in our solar system. Pluto was reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006.

questions.question: How many colors are in a rainbow?
questions.explanation: A rainbow has 7 colors: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, and violet (ROYGBIV).

questions.question: How many sides does a hexagon have?
questions.explanation: A hexagon has 6 sides. The prefix 'hex' comes from the Greek word for six.

questions.question: How many justices serve on the United States Supreme Court?
questions.explanation: The U.S. Supreme Court has 9 justices: one Chief Justice and eight Associate Justices.

questions.question: How many original colonies formed the United States?
questions.explanation: There were 13 original colonies, which is why the American flag has 13 stripes.

questions.question: How many cards are in a standard deck of playing cards?
questions.explanation: A standard deck has 52 playing cards, divided into 4 suits of 13 cards each.

questions.question: How many rings are in the Olympic symbol?
questions.explanation: The Olympic symbol has 5 interlocking rings, representing the five continents united by the Olympic movement.

questions.question: How many signs are there in the zodiac?
questions.explanation: There are 12 zodiac signs, starting with Aries and ending with Pisces, each covering roughly one month.

questions.question: How many bones are in the adult human body?
questions.explanation: An adult human body has 206 bones. Babies are born with about 270 bones, but many fuse together as they grow.

questions.question: How many amendments make up the Bill of Rights in the U.S. Constitution?
questions.explanation: The Bill of Rights consists of the first 10 amendments to the U.S. Constitution, ratified in 1791.

questions.question: How many Great Lakes are there in North America?
questions.explanation: There are 5 Great Lakes: Superior, Michigan, Huron, Erie, and Ontario. Remember them with the acronym HOMES.

questions.question: How many strings does a standard acoustic guitar have?
questions.explanation: A standard guitar has 6 strings. A bass guitar typically has 4 strings, while some specialty guitars have 12.
